issue.subject: Add ability to set MAP resolutions (Remove the GXP Viewer blank baselayer)
issue.description:
As we are WMTS users, we'd to be able to set MAP fixed resolutions.
This would allow us to have nice 'sharp' tiles, instead of blurry map in intermediates zoom levels.

This could be done (like for other optional properties) by:
* adding an optional config field in backend edition of a MAP.
* setting the value to JS in data var
* testing it in components/com_easysdi_map/helpers/map.js line 355+

journals.notes: Resolutions must be defined on the WMTS base layer.

I'm still unable to force the MAP to fit the WMTS scales.

Tried:
serverResolutions
resolutions
force the numZoomLevels
force the matrixIds

nothing helps

After some research and testing (Yves and Thomas), it appears that it's work good on 4.2 but not anymore since 4.3.

This is a defect introduced in 4.3

Found the source:
* The GXP Viewer has a default blank baselayer (I suppose it is here to allow maps without baselayers in GXP since openlayers needs a baselayer for every map).
* This baselayer has Openlayers calculated resolutions, and since it is the first baselayer, it forces the resolutions on the map.

Proposed fix in this commit:
* In easySDI we cannot have a MAP without baselayer, so I propose here to overwrite the @gxp.Viewer.prototype.initMapPanel@ method in @/joomla/easysdi/com_easysdi_core/src/administrator/libraries/easysdi/js/gxp/widgets/Viewer.js@ and remove this blank baselayer.

It works for me with:
* A MAP with one baselayer + one or more overlays
* A MAP with multiple baselayers (one active) + one or more overlays

Revision : 9087
